channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Southern California on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: DOPPLER: Differentially Private Optimizers with Low-pass Filter for Privacy Noise Reduction
item.description: DOPPLER, a novel low-pass filter, significantly enhances differentially private (DP) optimizer performance by reducing the impact of privacy noise, bridging the gap between DP and non-DP training.

item.title: Dynamic Subgroup Identification in Covariate-adjusted Response-adaptive Randomization Experiments
item.description: A new dynamic subgroup identification strategy, using covariate-adjusted response-adaptive randomization, efficiently identifies best-performing subgroups in clinical trials, improving resource alloca…

item.title: Enabling Adaptive Agent Training in Open-Ended Simulators by Targeting Diversity
item.description: DIVA: Evolutionary task generation for robust, adaptable AI agents in complex simulators.

item.title: Optimal Multiclass U-Calibration Error and Beyond
item.description: This paper proves the minimax optimal U-calibration error is Œò(‚àöKT) for online multiclass prediction, resolving an open problem and showing logarithmic error is achievable for specific loss functions.

item.title: Spectral Learning of Shared Dynamics Between Generalized-Linear Processes
item.description: PGLDM, a novel algorithm, accurately identifies shared and private dynamics in two generalized-linear time series, improving model accuracy and enabling lower-dimensional latent state representations.

item.title: Transformers Learn to Achieve Second-Order Convergence Rates for In-Context Linear Regression
item.description: Transformers surprisingly learn second-order optimization methods for in-context linear regression, achieving exponentially faster convergence than gradient descent!

item.title: When is Multicalibration Post-Processing Necessary?
item.description: Multicalibration post-processing isn’t always necessary; models often implicitly achieve it, especially calibrated ones. For uncalibrated models, though, it significantly improves fairness.
